entry.et: Middle English, from Anglo-French masle, male, adjective & noun, from Latin masculus masculine

def.dt: :a male person :a man or a boy
:an individual that produces small usually motile gametes (as spermatozoa or spermatozoids) which fertilize the eggs of a female
:of, relating to, or being the sex that produces gametes which fertilize the eggs of a female
:having only staminate flowers and not producing fruit or seeds a male holly
:of, relating to, or characteristic of the male sex a deep male voice
:made up of usually adult male individuals a male choir
:designed with a projecting part for fitting into a corresponding female part male hose coupling
island (atoll), chief of the Maldives pop 74,069; contains the nation's ✽
:a fern (Dryopteris filix-mas) producing an oleoresin used in expelling tapeworms
:typical hereditary baldness in the male characterized by loss of hair on the crown and temples
:having male gametes lacking or nonfunctional male–sterile plants
